snippet: The assaults raised tensions in an African nation pulsing with violence since President Pierre Nkurunziza won a controversial third term in office.
abstract: Gunmen in Bujumbura, Burundi, execute coordinated attacks, leading stores to close and residents to lock themselves indoors; is most significant attack since failed coup attempt in May, but not isolated incident as nation has been fraught with violence since declaration of Pres Pierre Nkurunziza's win for third term.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The assaults raised tensions in an African nation pulsing with violence since President Pierre Nkurunziza won a controversial third term in office.

headline.main: Burundi Military Sites Raided by Gunmen, Renewing Fears of Chaos
headline.print_headline: Burundi Military Sites Raided by Gunmen, Renewing Fears of Chaos
